note.p: Clergyman. BA, Oxford, 1841; DD 1853. After ordination, held curacies in Alderney and Liverpool. Became principal of the Church of England Metropolitan Training Institution at Highbury, Middlesex, 1850. Bishop of Mauritius, 1855–67; consecrated new churches in Mahébourg, and in the Seychelles. Vicar of St Peter’s, Bournemouth, 1880–1. Held additional ecclesiastical posts in England until his death.
